SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler

Interface AppendState

public interface AppendState
Operations available when responding to an APPEND command.

APPEND adds a message to a mailbox. The handler first validates the target mailbox, then receives the message literal.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • AuthenticatedHandler.append(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, java.lang.String, java.util.Set<org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.Flag>, java.time.OffsetDateTime, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.AppendState)

  • Method Details

    • readyForData

      void readyForData(Mailbox mailbox, AppendDataHandler handler)
      Ready to receive message data for the given mailbox.

      Convenience method that accepts the literal and associates it with the target mailbox.

      Parameters:
      mailbox - the target mailbox
      handler - receives the message data

    • tryCreate

      void tryCreate(AuthenticatedHandler handler)
      Mailbox does not exist, client should try CREATE first.

      Sends a NO [TRYCREATE] response.

      Parameters:
      handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

    • appendFailed

      void appendFailed(String message, AuthenticatedHandler handler)
      Append failed.
      Parameters:
      message - the error message
      handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

    • acceptLiteral

      void acceptLiteral(int literalSize, AppendDataHandler handler)
      Accepts the append and requests the message literal.

      Sends a continuation response (+) and waits for the message data.

      Parameters:
      literalSize - the expected literal size
      handler - receives the message data

    • mailboxNotFound

      void mailboxNotFound(String message, AuthenticatedHandler handler)
      Mailbox does not exist.
      Parameters:
      message - the error message
      handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

    • cannotAppend

      void cannotAppend(String message, AuthenticatedHandler handler)
      Cannot append to this mailbox.
      Parameters:
      message - the error message
      handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

    • messageTooLarge

      void messageTooLarge(long maxSize, AuthenticatedHandler handler)
      Message is too large.
      Parameters:
      maxSize - the maximum allowed size
      handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

    • serverShuttingDown

      void serverShuttingDown()
      Server is shutting down, close gracefully.

      Sends an untagged BYE response indicating the server is shutting down and closes the connection.
